Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to publicly post reports concerning cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator training.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to publicly post reports concerning cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator training.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of all-terrain vehicles, including dirt bikes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Use of all-terrain vehicles, including dirt bikes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the publication of the NYPD patrol guide, and to repeal paragraph 2 of subdivision a of section 14-150 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to quarterly submission of the NYPD patrol guide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Quarterly submission of the NYPD patrol guide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on seized property data on an annual basis and removing an existing requirement concerning reporting on disposition of certain unclaimed property
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to report on seized property data on an annual basis and removing an existing requirement concerning reporting on disposition of certain unclaimed property.

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY
Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Briana’s Law, requiring all police officers to be retrained in cardiopulmonary resuscitation every two years.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to codifying the procedures offering vehicle owners the opportunity to recover possession of a vehicle seized in connection with an arrest, implemented by court order pursuant to Krimstock v. Kelly, 306 F.3d 40 (2d Cir. 2002).
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Codifying the procedures offering vehicle owners the opportunity to recover possession of a vehicle seized in connection with an arrest, implemented by court order.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to publicly post reports concerning cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator training.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
